src.run module¶

src.run.cmd_web(host: str, port: int, debug: bool) → None[source]¶

Start the Flask web application.

Parameters:

  • host (str) – Hostname or IP address to bind (e.g., "0.0.0.0").

  • port (int) – TCP port for the server.

  • debug (bool) – Whether to enable Flask debug mode (reloader & debugger).

Returns:

None

Return type:

NoneType

src.run.cmd_pipeline(max_records: int, delay: float) → None[source]¶

Execute the end-to-end data pipeline.

This triggers scraping, cleaning, LLM-based normalization, and loading.

Parameters:

  • max_records (int) – Maximum number of records to process.

  • delay (float) – Delay in seconds between network requests.

Returns:

None

Return type:

NoneType

src.run.main() → None[source]¶

Parse CLI arguments and dispatch to the chosen command.

Subcommands¶

  • web:

    • --host (str, default "0.0.0.0")

    • --port (int, default 8080")

    • --debug (flag)

  • pipeline:

    • --max-records (int, default 100)

    • --delay (float, default 0.5)

If no subcommand is provided, the function defaults to starting the web app.

return:

None

rtype:

NoneType
